page.title: 03Hadstock Women's Institute
page.content: About two dozen ladies in Hadstock meet once a month in the village hall for a meeting, which usually centres around a talk or demonstration by an invited speaker. Some of the members are quite young, and others have been members for many years. Most of the WI members are also involved in other village activities, so that when an event like the village fete draws near, everybody is involved in preparing things to be sold on the stalls. But one particular way in which the WI has helped other people is by knitting squares to be sewn together to make blankets. The WI sends delegates to larger gatherings of ladies, but because they are a small meeting, they may get the opportunity to be represented only in alternate years.
